Package com.egehurturk.httpd

Class HttpServer

java.lang.Object
com.egehurturk.core.BaseServer
com.egehurturk.httpd.HttpServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class HttpServer
extends BaseServer
implements java.io.Closeable
HTTP Server for providing HTTP connection. Uses TCP as 4th layer defined in OSI for a server-client based server This class is a child of BaseServer class which provides abstraction over TCP/IPv4 communication. This class also overrides the inner class BaseServer.ConnectionManager. A lot of work (processing HTTP requests) is done inside the BaseServer.ConnectionManager class.

Provides methods for parsing, reading, sending HTTP headers. Configured via these fields:

  • Server port
  • Server host
  • Backlog

In general, each connection request made of a client is accepted by ServerSocket. Inner class BaseServer.ConnectionManager handles the connection. Uses BufferedReader and PrintWriter for communicating with sockets. InputStream and OutputStream are received by the socket itself, and then passed into BufferedReader and PrintWriter.

    • propertiesStream

      protected java.io.InputStream propertiesStream
      File location of .properties file located in InputStream to perform IO operations (specifically reading the properties file) on the data.

      All of the settings are required in the properties file, located in the resources directory in the standard Maven project DIR.

      Chained constructor for initializing with only port.

      Throws:
      java.net.UnknownHostException - - required for InetAddress to hold the host name (IPv4)

    • HttpServer

      public HttpServer​(int serverPort, java.net.InetAddress serverHost, int backlog, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String webRoot, boolean debugMode)
      Base constructor that has all fields as arguments. Is used for manually configuring fields (Port, host, backlog). Uses super class BaseServer. Checks for valid port, backlog.
      Parameters:
      serverPort - - Server port that ServerSocket listens on
      serverHost - - Server host that ServerSocket operates in ("localhost")
      backlog - - Number of pending requests in the queue
      name - - Name of the server for running or stopping from CL
      webRoot - - Web Root of the server for URL processing
      debugMode - - Whether the Debugging mode enabled or not
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - Throws for value of port that is out of range, described below
